review_text: I was looking for a place that was quiet, remote and not in town. This is a cabin on the hosts property. The photos seemed to show no one nearby but their were neighbors. Most of the properties were large and it was very rural. I was a little disappointed about that but I should have asked more questions. I liked the full kitchen a lot and the interior was very nicely done. The only negative, which was important to me, is the main bed was very hard. This may not be an issue for others but is something good to remember to ask in the future. I slept with the windows open which was a treat coming from Phoenix. It's east of town and an easy commute. Host was responsive and helped me when needed. I would recommend this cabin. You can't beat the price for what you get.

name: Poul
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Spent 3 nights at Tamaki's place while participating in a dog show. The cabin is super nice. It has a full kitchen, a separate bedroom, a fold-out bed in the day area, and an upstairs loft. It sits right up against National Forest Land which makes for beautiful views. The neighborhood is very quiet - no noise at all, except for a bit of ambience when trains come chugging by at night. The distance to the center of town may be a bit much for some, but for us the secluded location was perfect. Tamaki herself was super friendly and very quick to respond.
Notes: The bathroom has a soaking tub, not a shower stall. This could be a non-starter for those with limited mobility. Also, we were there at the peak of the 2023 summer heat wave, and the cabin did get very warm during the day. But with fans in most windows it was possible to bring temps low enough to sleep comfortably.
We will definitely try Tamaki's place again, maybe when the weather cools down a bit.

The water was hot and even filling up the whole tub, I did not run out of hot water! We drove up 89 to the Desert View road into the Grand Canyon via the east entrance (cabin was an an excellent location for that). This path allowed us to take in the Grand Canyon stopping at several of the 8â€9 viewpoints with hardly any other people.
We would love to stay here again in the future and take in the stars and even have a campfire!

review_text: Outstanding spacious clean house with everything you may need for a stay and more. The floor plan is very convenient for two traveling couples, as we were. But you forget all of this as you exit to the magnificent waterfront backyard open to a clear channel good for swimming, kayaking, and boating. A great blue heron was coming to our place every day to check on us pacing the yard and peeking through the window. We took kayaks provided by Tim to paddle to nearby Ellie Schiller Homosassa Springs Wildlife State Park to watch manatees in pristine clear waters. Would definitely stay in this place again. Thank you, Tim.

We were a little hesitant about staying in a home that is someoneâ€™s permanent home, but I really loved it! It felt so comfortable and loved in there. The interior was actually nicer than the photos which never happens!
We loved waking up and getting in our Kayaks(they did have a double there too but we had our own) and having our morning visit with the manatees just a light paddle away. We spent all our time on the lovely converted enclosed porch and out back by the water.
The home was so well organized, everything seemed to be just where we expected it to be. I didnâ€™t find myself looking for anything I couldnâ€™t find. The hosts were so responsive, the neighbors were great. I could have stayed forever. Iâ€™m a fairly picky airbnber, so thatâ€™s saying something! And for my fellow allergy/asthma sufferers, I had no issues. Iâ€™m hyper sensitive to mold and Tim communicated when I asked that there was no mold, there wasnâ€™t at all. 10 out of 10.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We needed a few days to get away from it all and chill, and Sheila's place was just perfect. We did plan activities every day--Homosassa State Park, Crystal River, Weeki Wachee State Park, and of course restaurants--but this house is great for just sitting, relaxing, fishing and canoeing if you want.
We often sat out back, watched the wildlife on the river, and read. I could also do my pilates routine on an outdoor rug out there. Sheila had bug spray available, but mosquitoes weren't a problem outside, where it was always cool and peaceful.
I found a couch to perch on and read in the living room. With the help of terrific wifi, we broke our television habit for four days and watched YouTube instead.
Sheila might live there, but she was practically invisible, except when we needed something. like a lightbulb, and she magically appeared. She's lovely to talk with and told us all about how her husband built the property, which we strolled all the way to the "point."

Stayed with kids
review_text: We enjoyed staying here so much! It was close to town yet you can â€˜stay homeâ€™ and fish, canoe, & sit by the canal & watch for manatees. We took out the canoe & paddled to the springs, & saw SO MANY MANATEES. During our stay, we caught 25ish hand sized mangrove snappers, a small blue gill, a sting ray, & an 18 inch long large mouth bass and we saw 6 manatee come in/out of the canal (February/manatee season). The canal water is clear enough to where you can see the fish as they are biting your bait. We saw lots of sheepshead, mullet, & stingrays. We also saw an otter twice! As for the house, it was extremely clean & if you had questions, Sheila would get right back to you. Shower had good water pressure & you can sleep on the more firm (but not hard) bed or the pull out with a very cushy and comfy mattress on it (I never thought I would say I slept so well on a pull out couch but it was awesome)! Thanks Shelia for providing a slice of heaven for us for a few days! We had the best time!â¤ï¸

Best waterfront spot for the price! Not modern or new but very clean. Huge bonus, access to a kayak or canoe. There are several kayaking routes to discover from the property. I was fortunate enough to see dolphins, manatees, flying fish, and a whole collection of birds.
The home is attached to the host's home, but your home has its own privacy area. This allowed me to ask my questions and take advantage of his advice. She set up a chair on the tip of her grounds so I could watch the sunrise. She also left me a good dessert.
When you arrive. The unit door is on the left and carries the Air B&B badge in the window. The front door opens into the big room. The living room is in the back with a door leading to the grounds and large windows overlooking the water. The screened-in gallery is for the owner but she invites us to use it.

Through the front door is the bedroom (very comfortable bed), which leads to the kitchen galley on the right, and the bathroom is to the left. Then to the back is the living area with the sleeper sofa. This area has a view of the water and a door to the backyard. There is a tandem canoe and solo kayak available. I went kayaking one day and we enjoyed canoeing the next. Homosassa Springs is a short distance away. We saw plenty of birds and were thrilled with the experience of kayaking in the area of a mother manatee and her two calves. Sheila is an excellent host and we enjoyed talking with her. Wished we could have stayed longer; 4 nights wasnâ€™t long enough!

review_text: Shelia is an exceptional host, offers and explains her home, amenities and the surrounding area. We enjoyed and used the canoe and kayak availability every day almost! It was so nice to have firewood available also to have a fire by the water one evening. There is so much to enjoy without even leaving the property! Grilling, swimming, canoeing, kayaking, sun bathing, fishing, enjoying the sunset, watching the water traffic, water life and beautiful surroundings. It was a wonderful and unique experience fit for all ages. It definitely did not disappoint. Of a 12 day Florida vacation that started with a week at a beach resort on the east coast, this was my sonâ€™s absolute favorite part of vacation. This was the perfect end to our trip. The manatee festival was taking place the weekend we were visiting, in the next town over. There was plenty to see and do all around. Stores for most all needs are very close. Everything was wonderful- host, location, experiences, amenities. We will definitely be back!

name: Glynn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This waterfront apartment was perfect for our 4-night stay in Homosassa/Crystal River. The 2 of us certainly could have stayed longer as it is comfortable, convenient and an excellent value. The apartment is so much more spacious than a hotel room and the water views are spectacular. We enjoyed coffee in the morning, from the living room area which provided gorgeous, peaceful views of the water. Additionally, there is a patio just outside the apartment, where we sipped coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, while viewing the water and listening to so many birds. From the patio we saw heron, wood stork, ducks and so many other birds. It appears to be a very healthy ecosystem.
There's a kayak, canoe and rowboat on the property, although we did not use them since we brought our own kayaks. We launched from the backyard, right into the canal and paddled 5 minutes to the spring to see the manatees, which were plentiful during late March. We were treated with being able to view at least 15 manatees in a short time period, many of which swam right under our kayaks and were easy to see in the clear water. We also enjoyed walking around the safe neighborhood either early morning, or after dinner.
Other reviewers have commented about the squeaky springs of the queen bed in the bedroom. Yes, the springs are noisy when first sitting on the bed, however we found the bed to be comfortable and we slept well. The apartment is easy to find using GPS and is located on a quiet, safe, cul-de-sac. The location provided peaceful sleep and beautiful, dark starry skies. Sheila is an excellent host who provided helpful information for the area. While she lives in the attached home, she was respectful of our privacy, and accessible if we had questions. We greatly enjoyed our stay and will certainly return.

The bed is squeaky and could be replaced, but was very comfortable. You might want to bring something to cover your eyes to block out the morning sun in the bedroom.

The setting is absolutely lovely--facing out on the canal as well as the expanse of the Homosassa River. Sitting in the shade (or sun-it has both) of her yard is a great place to read , if you can tear yourself away from watching the ibis, storks and herons in the surrounding yards.
The apartment suited our needs very well. Although some reviewers had negative comments on the bed, we found it very comfortable. The bath is beautiful with a great shower head and plenty of pressure. One thing we found particularly useful was the set of TV trays that we could use to give us extra surface space where we needed it. We would definitely recommend it for a single or couple staying in Homosassa.

review_text:
Pros: very clean! Central to all things & activities around Homosassa, close by to stores & restaurants. Nice to be so close to the canals, and you can see fish literally jumping out of the canal. Host supplied some breakfast rolls and coffee, nice touch. Check in very easy, really low if any crime in area. One peculiarity-while thereâ€™s a canoe & paddle board on site, host refused to let me use paddle board, though to be fair the listing doesnâ€™t feature that. The canoe was available but the life jackets were stored in a container/trunk that contained gas, and the smell of fuel predictably saturated those so we didnâ€™t use them.
Cons: There is a very small coffee maker on site, and there were no microwave safe dishes except for a single dinner plate. The bed is very squeaky, and was a bit soft. The air conditioning system seems to be on two different duct runs, one for each the sitting room and the bedroom. The sitting room was noticeably cooler than the bedroom.
Overall: very reasonably priced, but the cons for us outweighed the pros, other opinions in other reviews differ. Either we are pickier or those renters are more tolerant, the above are my honest thoughts. If on a budget, this is a decent place to stay.

review_text:
Me and my family stayed here for 9 days and enjoyed it so much.
The location is stunning and the back deck and dock made a great spot for morning coffee and evening fishing.
Which by the wayâ€¦you catch fish constantly and might see a gator or two!
We ended up buying 4 fishing poles and donated them to the house :)
We took a day to go to Crystal River (25min away) and a couple days spent at Hunters Beach (15 min away highly recommend) to swim with manatees, go kayaking with the provided kayaks, and tan.
We even drove and hour 35 to Disney and spent a long day there.
This location was great for short trips but not if you want a ton of restaurants. That was the only limitation of the location. However with a Publix at the top of the street and the grill, we had fun enjoying family dinners together at the house.
As of group of 4 the place worked great. Any more and I could see it getting a little tight as the pictures make it seem a bit more spacious. The kitchen was workable.

It had many restaurants that were dog-friendly patio and less than an hour away from beautiful Rainbow springs-there is a dog friendly kayak place thereâ€”we really enjoyed our trip there with the dogsâ€”I was unfortunately attending a funeral near, but it was a relief to be in such dog-friendly welcoming home (she even had dog treats & bowls, little Nick knacks like dog paw pillows and books). name: Melanie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
February 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Two words that describe this place is: affordable luxury. We are so grateful for the 4 peaceful nights we spent at The River Pearl. We LOVE kayaking and spent hours and hours in the kayaks on the peaceful inlets. It was so easy with the boat lift that puts you right into the water and lifts you back out.
The jacuzzi was perfection. The loft was perfection, clean, comfortable, quiet, and had everything we needed. Our private beach and fire pit was perfection. One night we got out of the jacuzzi and we heard blows, there were dolphins splashing around right by the dock!!
One word of advice: do not kayak near the shore during/close to dusk, a tidal wave (alligator) launched into the water after a fish, very close to my husband. That was a rush...
We saw manatees, herons, pelicans, bald eagle, cormorants, osprey, seagulls, egrets, and the monkeys at Monkey Island, I named them Peter, Paul and Mary. It was lovely feeding flowers to resident tortoise Humphrey Bogart and giving pets to the fluffiest cat Charlie.
And finally, our hosts. Sunday is a goddess mermaid and her compassion for others shines. She is so very kind, laid back, and welcoming. She made us 2 phenomenal homemade vegan breakfasts, delivered to our door. Sal is such a kind soul, also so welcoming and laid back.
We work hard at home. We needed this vacation badly, it did not disappoint, and we absolutely cannot wait to come back.
Much love,
Melanie and Jay
Rooster Redemption, Minnesota

The property is absolutely beautiful being right off the water. She has a private beach with chairs and fire pit, along with bikes and kayaks for your personal use. And to our surprise, surrounded by fruit trees is an adorable tiki bar and chair swing overlooking the water. A perfect place to watch the sun rise and set. If you are looking for a place to get away to from all the chaos, River Pearl is a priceless gem.

review_text:
Wow. I don't know what I can say that hasn't been said before but what a wonderful place. We loved the peaceful location, hospitality and wonderful hosts. It felt like home. Sunday and Sal are the best!
Things we enjoyed - sitting on the amazing swing by the water, watching the jumping fish, Charlie the cat greeting us outside in the morning, delicious breakfasts!! (seriously yum), Humphrey Bogart the turtle, beautiful accommodations, coffee on the beach, kayaking, beautiful sunsets, the property is so beautiful it's like an oasis .......so many things!
Luckily the tropical storm turned when we were there but we still had a lot of rain. Not a bad place for some quiet time and relaxation. This is the place to quiet your mind and provide healing.
Locally - recommend the Wild Sassa Food Trailer had great shrimp tacos (a big group next to us had the red snapper and said it was amazing they even ordered more)
Florida Cracker Monkey Bar- great crab dip (and we are MD people so we are picky) and delicious pizza
Homosassa Springs Wildlife State Park - fun to see lots of animals
Thank you Sunday and Sal for welcoming us to your home and giving us a wonderful stay. We hope to be back soon!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Sunday and Sal are warm and welcoming people. They offer a wide range of amenities for people who might simply want to hang around and relax. We found their place clean, well-equipped and plenty roomy for two. We enjoyed paddling around in kayaks and would like to have had more time to enjoy the many amenities they offer. Sunday had several good suggestions for dinner. Wallace's At The Greenhouse was a good place for casual dining. If you have a passion for food, we would highly recommend Catch 22; here we enjoyed the "Catch of the Moment" (Cobia) and Maryland Style Crab Cakes. Like all guests, we were given the royal breakfast treatment by Sunday and Sal; it was delicious and the portions were generous. The check in and check out times were most generous, as were our hosts, Sunday and Sal. We wish we had more time to enjoy the "The River Pearl", which is a very peaceful, quiet and serene slice of paradise on a small tributary of the Homosassa River.

Stayed one night
review_text: Paradise found! If you're looking for an amazing place with views, charm, special touches and an outstanding host to experience all Florida's Nature Coast has to offer look no further. The River Pearl cottage is perfect. Sunday, your host, makes the place feel like it's yours. The property is full of Florida character, warm and welcoming with high-end resort qualities. The cottage is cozy, spotless clean and well-appointed with a large deck that overlooks the water, salt marsh, palms, cedars and pines that make up the beautiful Homosassa landscape. The extra large dock is an adult playground with a tiki bar, hot tube, swings, and other comfortable places to hangout and relax, plus you're own sandy beach and firepit just for the quests of the River Pearl. For boaters, there's plenty of dock space and room to park your vehicle and trailer. Literally Sunday has thought of everything possible, including a great breakfast in the morning to make your stay perfect. I can't wait to return.

This ABNB is spacious and welcoming as you enter the front door. The floor plan is simple, both bedrooms have their own spacious bathrooms. The back porch is screened in overlooking the back yard and fire pit. Great spot to spend an evening with family and friends.
The nights were chilly and we used the fireplace which was a warming touch. Tractor Supply had the best price for firewood.
While fishing from the dock, a large blue herring flew and landed on a building within 5 ft of us. It was a beautiful site. It then flew down and landed on our dock right in front of us. Wow
Kitchen was well stocked and had everything we needed.
If you like to see some wildlife, including manatees, I recommend
Homosassa State Park. It is close by, reasonably priced, peaceful and an easy walk.
The ABNB host were prompt and great to work with.

name: Sarah
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Fantastic house, unbeatable location! Lovely hosts were nearby to answer any questions and provide local knowledge. We trailered our boat (25') and it fit perfectly at the dock with trailer parking on site. It was wonderful to be able to look out the windows at night to check on the boat. Having storage under the house immediately next to the dock for tubes, floats, snorkeling gear, etc was exceptionally convenient. Kids loved dropping in lines off the dock for bass and blue gill and rumor has it mangroves frequent , too. We were there to scallop so being on one of the furthest west canals off the main span of the river put us close to the Gulf while ice/fuel/cocktails/food were a short ride to the east and the springs just past. If you're not local, you'll want to be on one of these main river span canals as it's a pretty unforgiving backcountry, we were grateful to be in well marked canals/channels so we could relax and enjoy our time! House was perfect, comfortable and clean with everything we needed, blender included! We cooked nightly and appreciated the well stocked kitchen. We'll be back!

If we go back to Flagstaff, this is where I'm staying.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We've stayed at alot of airbnb places, and this one was truly outstanding. Renee and Carlos obviously took a lot of care in setting it up. There was absolutely NOTHING needed and lots of special extra touches from applicances and personal items to great snacks! Its convenient to all of Flagstaff, and one can easily avoid Rte 66. The porch (heater) and patio (fire pit) are lovely to sit and just relax and enjoy the cool summer breezes..we're from Tucson where it was over 100. Inside, the furnishing are tasteful, the bed comfortable, the shower large (rain shower head), and the kitchen area is beautiful. It has full sized grey stainless steel appliances and all the tools. Lots of spices, coffee, tea, extra ice, etc. are all there. The shelves are beautiful live edge mesquite! The TV has all the streaming channels one could want, including Amazon and Netflix. And, of course, the hosts are right next door, friendly and available. Who could ask for anything more.

review_text:
Renee and Carlos host a lovely little home! Plenty of amenities and some extras! Every inch of the space was very clean and so cozy! Their pictures for check-in were accurate and very helpful, it was easy to find the spot and get inside. The space is so smartly built and arranged. The shower is SO NICE. There was even a cute little basket of snacks to enjoy.
I arrived with a friend to stay the night before going on to the Grand Canyon. Weather was not on our side and we didn't end up making it to the Canyon, but Renee was kind enough to check in with us about the weather, let us know about road closures in the area, and even let us check out late so we could wait until roads were clearer. The sidewalk and stairs were shoveled and salted, as was the driveway behind my car. Our only regret was not being able to stay in this cute tidy space a little longer, if you're coming to Flagstaff definitely check this spot out!

2nd - The power went out 4 times in the middle of the night over a two day stay. Chris helped provide direction on how to start the generate. Overall: 4/5 Stars

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The Thundercliffe lodge is perfect; nestled at the edge of a meadow and surrounded by national forest, it is the perfect peaceful place to enjoy family time together and appreciate nature. The lodge itself is so thoughtfully decorated and comfortable that you feel like you are staying at a friend's well-appointed home; I especially loved the cozy little reading nooks that were perfect for relaxing with a good book. The kitchen had lots of supplies, and in addition to the well-appointed interior, there are great places to hang out outside on the front patio and an outdoor fire pit. The location is great, too; nice hiking nearby, and less than an hour from the south rim of the Grand Canyon, Wupatki and Sunset Crater N.M.s, and lots of good restaurants in Flagstaff only 15 minutes away. We would love to come back another time soon! :)

The only things that made it a bad experience were that there was no microwave and no wifi, and the dvd player didnt work or wasnt connected to the tv properly. I also would have appreciated if they came out to try and fix the wifi instead of just messaging us to restart it or saying they would call about it the next day. I was there with my family on a working trip and was unable to do any work and I didnt have any cell service either with at&t. We also didnt know until check in that we had to remove all the bedding and towels and put them in the laundry or do the dishes etc. Just please be more transparent and honest and have a little more quick customer service going forward. I will however not be staying there again.

review_text:
Chris's cabin is wonderful - we really can't recommend it enough. It's even more charming than the photos suggest, and our family declared it one of the best places we've stayed!
After a couple of nights in hotels on our trip around National Parks, this cabin felt like an oasis - and with a huge washer and dryer and plenty of hot water (despite being an off grid cabin), it really allowed us the chance to clean up and recharge. Even though it's a 2 bedroom there was plenty of room to spread out. And although we were there during snow so didn't get a chance to use the outside spaces - I can only imagine how nice it would be to sit on the covered front porch in slightly warmer weather and take in the amazing view.
Chris was so welcoming and helpful and genuinely a super host.
(One thing to mention - the upstairs 2nd bedroom is accessed by a spiral staircase which is totally stable and secure, but just something to be aware of if your group has really little ones or anyone who is a little unsteady on their feet.)
This really is a perfect cabin - highly, highly recommend!!

It is close to Grand Canyon, numerous trails and places to explore in the Coconino and Kaibab National Forests, and it is a short trip back to Flagstaff for supplies or just to visit Flag.
While there is wi-fi, it is way off the grid so don't come expecting highspeed broadband. Email and web surfing is fine. Streaming is spotty. But you didn't come out here to stay inside and watch Netflix did you?

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Amazing place! This property is very cool. The main house has plenty of room for several guests. The downstairs bed is very large and comfortable. The bathroom has double sinks and a really neat stone shower/bath. Super comfy bedding and towels. The kitchen had everything we needed and the grill was great. We loved the extra large table outside for dining al fresco. The couches in the living room were nice. The dÃ©cor is amazing. A couple of our kids used the pull out couch to sleep on. The upstairs bed is good size and the bathroom is pretty nice with a standup shower.
We didnâ€™t need to use the 2nd cabin but it had enough room for another couple. The yurt also looked like a fun place to stay. The property is well maintained and has a koi fish pond. There was a thunderstorm and we saw a huge double rainbow afterward. We had planned to make a fire outside but didnâ€™t have time with all the fun stuff to do in the area. We ate at a few restaurants downtown and all were wonderful. We visited Bearizona which was less than an hour away and a really neat lava park not too far away â€“ Sunset Crater Volcano. We definitely recommend this place. Chris was very nice!

name: Brittany
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
July 2017
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: First, the scenery at this place is amazing. My Wife and 3.5-year-old Son shared this place with two other couples. One couple had a 1.5-year-old, and the other couple had an eight and nine-year-old plus an infant. My Wife and I got there early and were met by the owner's Wife. She was super nice, and gave a good run-down on the place. We were initially a little surprised when she told us her Son and FiancÃ© were staying in the cabin directly next to the main cabin and another family was staying in the Yurt. Not a huge deal, but it might be a deal breaker for other renters to know that the owner's Son is literally staying in a cabin about 25 feet away. I would inquire about this if you are interested in this rental property. In terms of the sleeping situation. The main cabin has a king bed in the master bedroom with a full-bath. The living room has a pull-out sofa about the size of a twin bed. Upstairs has a queen bed, and a pull-out sofa which is also about the the size of a twin bed. Upstairs has a full bathroom. The main cabin is nice. The kitchen had everything we needed. Moths/insects/flies were a bit of an issue, but the place is completely off the grid so it did not bother anyone. Downstairs in the main cabin it was easy to regulate temperature with the windows/verbal instructions the owner provided. However, upstairs was significantly warmer than downstairs, and it was borderline uncomfortable to take a nap upstairs and fall asleep at night. A fan upstairs is highly recommended. We stayed from 31 June - 4 July. The Wi-Fi worked great, but we never tested out the television. However, the main cabin did have some sort of satellite service. I would also inquire about the washer and dryer. The owner did not mention it, but the 9-year-old seemed to find his way past the locked door in the master bedroom where he discovered a utility room of sort with a washer and dryer. The outdoor patio was one of our favorite parts about the main cabin. During the day, and in the evening, it was great. There is a nice Weber grill and furniture to sit about 8 people. The other cabin was also neat, but is just a place to sleep. If I remember here is a queen or full bed plus a another twin size bed. There is no bathroom or shower in this cabin. Again the other cabin was occupied by the Owner's Son, and the Yurt was occupied by another family. The Owner's do not allow pets, however the other two couples we shared the place with brought their dogs. I told the owner this shortly after we arrived as soon as I found out the animals were coming. Understandably I could tell she was not pleased, but she was very understanding and allowed the two dogs to stay...

name: Elizabeth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2017
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Thundercliffe Lodge is an authentic rustic yet immensely comfortable cabin nestled into the forest surrounding the highest mountain peaks of Arizona. Even in June snowy patches could be seen on Mt Humphrey. The location is superb for day trips to the Grand Canyon, Williams' Train Depot, Mystic Sedona, Native American ruins, and forest hikes galore. Only 20 minutes to downtown Flagstaff is a historic district of quaint shops with everything from handcrafts to luxury artworks. Our first night we had fish & chips at Collinâ€™s Irish Pub, another night fine dining on linen tablecloths at Josephineâ€™s Bistro. There are several microbreweries all within a walking distance, so pack comfortable shoes. However, you may never want to leave the lodge as it has everything to enjoy a respite in nature, the smell of pines, wildflowers and pond all attract deer, rabbits, birds (from hummingbirds to raptures) no binocular required; they are that close. Chris was an amazing host, friendly, accommodating and informative. He had recommendations to hikes off the beaten path with tips only locals know. An exciting plus for me was actually finding all 13 spices/ingredients right in the cabinet to make traditional Chai tea on the stove! Nothing beats sipping a warm drink from a pottery mug watching sunrise and set sitting on bent willow furniture in the middle of Thundercliffeâ€™s ten acres. We loved it and hope to visit again.

We absolutely loved staying here! The photos honestly do NOT do it justice at all. House IS smaller than I thought, but we spent most of our time outside anyway (be it in a screened porch area or the backyard, or out and about), so we didn't mind it at all. The house is much nicer, and the backyard is much nicer than I thought it would be. Staying here made us want to move to the area!
We have a lot of littles, and they enjoyed being downstairs watching movies and running around. The older littles enjoyed going on the kayaks and paddle boards with us. The water in the canals was clear and not too deep until you started getting out into the 'main' canals.
Drive to Tampa takes quite a while, longer than we thought it would. We should have focused almost entirely on more 'local' things to do. You can spend the entire time on the canals and get a great experience, but there's also Weeki Wachee nearby. Food choices are sparse, but there's a grocery store nearby.

review_text:
I can not say enough about this home. We visited for a peaceful family vacation on Mother's Day weekend and made so many memories on our trip.
This is a perfect house for families! The bottom floor is overwhelmingly equiped with games and activities for the kids to stay entertained the entire time and they had kayaks and life jackets for the whole crew. The home is clean and stocked with amenities to ensure a comfortable stay. I'm not lying when I say they had everything you could possibly need.
This trip was also a celebration for my husbands birthday and we invited friends and family from the Tampa area over for a bbq and they were all blown away and even asked for the link to book their own trip!
There are so many things to do with the family within a short distance and I would definitely recommend booking your trip for 4+ days. We arrived Thursday and left Sunday morning but I wish I had made the trip for at least two more days to get the full "river life experience".

The springs were just around the corner and the crack was so beautiful.
Kim was so thoughtful, We were there for our granddaughter's birthday and she had a present and balloon for her. I have stayed in rentals for vacation for over 10 years and this host and house is the best I have had so far!

Stayed with kids
review_text: I have used Airbnb and similar sites for YEARS, and this was my favorite stay yet! The house was impeccable, and it smelled amazing. We felt at home the minute we walked in. Everything was so thought out, and there was plenty of space. The downstairs offered the perfect hangout spot for the older boys, and the board games kept the younger ones occupied the entire trip. We had planned to drive to different springs in the area, but there was no need. We would eat breakfast, pack lunch, and set out on the kayaks. We traveled by kayak the entire trip! I was nervous at first, but we quickly learned to navigate the waters. Seven sisters spring is so close! We went way too far the first day and passed all the main attractions! Luckily, there were plenty of locals to help us along the way. Someone even gave us a map. (You can get one from the boat launch just past seven sisters). I HIGHLY recommend the crack! It was stunning! This was the perfect local experience with the best hosts!

review_text: Iâ€™ll likely run out of characters before I finish with my compliments. This place and the hosts were perfect. Great place to take your family and enjoy nature. The kayaking and springs are breathtaking. 5 of the kayaks at the house are brand new and very high quality and one is a tandem with 3 additional knock around boats (if you need them). Plenty of wildlife along the river including Manatee, otter, various birds including Bald Eagles. Seven Sisters Spring and the Crack are must sees when you are here. The house is beyond cute and comfortable and a great place for family time after a long paddle. It was just completed remodeled and the attention to detail is amazing. The lower level screen room is the best place to chill or play some games. Great restaurants are within a short drive too. The pictures really donâ€™t do this place justice and the neighbors were wonderful, welcoming people too. Allen and Kim will be the best hosts youâ€™ve ever had with a rental home! Thanks, Ken & Devon ğŸ‘

review_text:
Rich's place is the best!
It is extremely dog friendly. The small fenced in yard is amazing for dogs and offers peace of mind to let them roam around. Rich made a convenient blanket for the couch as well to protect the furniture.
Location is convenient! Super close to downtown. 15 min walk to all bars and restaurants or a $5 uber ride if you aren't up for walking.
Kitchen is great! Water temp and pressure in shower is great! WiFi is quick! Heating works amazing to keep you warm on cold nights!
Rich answers super quick if you have any questions.
The mattresses are very firm so if you can't sleep without a pillowy soft mattress, keep that in mind.
Amazing stay! This will be our place when we come back to Flagstaff!

The compact kitchen was well appointed with cooking supplies and even had spices & storage containers - a bonus for us, as we love to cook family-style meals together on vacation. The cozy bedrooms had super-comfy, firm beds. We appreciated the efficient use of space, including the full laundry facilities.

Additionally, any questions we had for the owner were answered within the hour. We would definitely come back to this Airbnb.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Exactly as expected. Plenty of room for 2. Outside grill a plus. No microwave- but pots/ pans to heat things up plus a toaster oven. Bathroom big enough.
We were in the area to see the manatee and were NOT disappointed. Went to Three Sisters Springs and saw TONS. Plus the beautiful trails and water. Downtown Crystal River had nice restaurants and shops.
Took the 1 1/2 hour car ride to Clearwater Beach- VERY crowded. Also went to Tarpon Springs- fun Greek town which makes you feel like you stepped into the movie MY BIF FAT GREEK WEDDING.
Overall plenty to do right around this area.
We enjoyed our time and this tiny home.
Bonus- very quiet and friendly neighborhood

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Like some of the other reviewers, we chose Erichâ€™s place because it was a tiny home, and we had never experienced that before. Although tiny, the home had much to offer and space where you needed it. The shower was roomy and the bathroom had enough space. Because of good organization, a lot was able to fit in the small kitchen. As my husband said â€œthis place mustâ€™ve been designed by a geniusâ€œ. There is a nice seating area outside and it was fun to have morning coffee there and chat with the people walking their dogs going by. Even though it is an RV park and the units are close to each other, there was plenty of privacy, and the neighbors were extremely friendly. It was also very quiet, despite being near a busy road and next-door to the camp host who is friendly and helpful. Thanks Erich

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The house was perfect for a short stay. The key was an absolute nightmare to deal with. Every time we had to use it, it would get stuck. The only thing I would change would have not having white everything. We were in constant panic of our muddy shoes, makeup etc staining. Also having instructions on how to use the washer/dryer combo would have helped tremendously. We had to leave with wet clothes and spent over 4 hours trying to figure out how to use it. Other then that the hosts were very responsive, the place was well stocked when most air bnbâ€™s give the bare minimum. The bedding was great quality and we were extremely surprised with how powerful the water pressure was. We would definitely stay here again.
